Server-Side Rendering

PhilJS provides powerful SSR capabilities with automatic hydration, streaming, and islands architecture.

Why SSR?

  • SEO: Search engines can crawl fully-rendered content
  • Performance: Faster initial page load and Time to Interactive
  • Accessibility: Content available without JavaScript
  • Social sharing: Proper meta tags for link previews

Rendering Modes

Client-Side Rendering (CSR)

Traditional SPA - JavaScript renders everything in the browser

Server-Side Rendering (SSR)

Server renders HTML, client hydrates for interactivity

Static Site Generation (SSG)

Pre-render pages at build time

Islands Architecture

Server-render static content, hydrate only interactive components

Basic SSR Setup

Terminal
$npm create philjs@latest my-ssr-app -- --template ssr
$cd my-ssr-app
$npm run dev

Entry Points

src/entry-client.tsxtypescript
1// src/entry-client.tsx
2import { hydrate } from 'philjs-core/web';
3import App from './App';
4 
5hydrate(() => <App />, document.getElementById('app')!);
src/entry-server.tsxtypescript
1// src/entry-server.tsx
2import { renderToString } from 'philjs-core/web';
3import App from './App';
4 
5export function render(url: string) {
6  const html = renderToString(() => <App url={url} />);
7  return { html };
8}

Data Fetching

Using createResource

1import { createResource } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function UserProfile(props: { userId: string }) {
4  const [user] = createResource(
5    () => props.userId,
6    async (id) => {
7      const res = await fetch(`/api/users/${id}`);
8      return res.json();
9    }
10  );
11 
12  return (
13    <Suspense fallback={<Spinner />}>
14      <Show when={user()}>
15        {(userData) => (
16          <div>
17            <h1>{userData.name}</h1>
18            <p>{userData.email}</p>
19          </div>
20        )}
21      </Show>
22    </Suspense>
23  );
24}
i

Automatic Serialization

Resources automatically serialize data during SSR and hydrate it on the client.

Server-Only Code

1import { isServer } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function SecureComponent() {
4  const [data] = createResource(async () => {
5    if (isServer) {
6      // This code only runs on the server
7      const db = await connectToDatabase();
8      return await db.query('SELECT * FROM secrets');
9    }
10    // Client fetches from API
11    return fetch('/api/data').then(r => r.json());
12  });
13 
14  return <div>{/* render data */}</div>;
15}

Streaming SSR

Stream HTML to the browser as it's generated, improving Time to First Byte:

server.tstypescript
1// server.ts
2import { renderToStream } from 'philjs-core/web';
3import { App } from './App';
4 
5app.get('*', async (req, res) => {
6  const stream = renderToStream(() => <App url={req.url} />);
7 
8  res.setHeader('Content-Type', 'text/html');
9 
10  stream.pipe(res);
11});

Out-of-Order Streaming

1function App() {
2  return (
3    <html>
4      <head>
5        <title>My App</title>
6      </head>
7      <body>
8        <header>
9          <h1>Welcome</h1>
10        </header>
11 
12        {/* This content streams first */}
13        <main>
14          <p>Static content loads immediately</p>
15 
16          {/* This suspends and streams later */}
17          <Suspense fallback={<Skeleton />}>
18            <AsyncContent />
19          </Suspense>
20        </main>
21 
22        <footer>
23          <p>Footer content</p>
24        </footer>
25      </body>
26    </html>
27  );
28}

Islands Architecture

Render static HTML and only hydrate interactive components:

1import { island } from 'philjs-core/web';
2 
3// Mark component as an island
4const Counter = island(() => {
5  const [count, setCount] = createSignal(0);
6 
7  return (
8    <button onClick={() => setCount(c => c + 1)}>
9      Count: {count()}
10    </button>
11  );
12});
13 
14function Page() {
15  return (
16    <div>
17      {/* Static content - no JavaScript */}
18      <h1>Welcome to my site</h1>
19      <p>This is static content</p>
20 
21      {/* Interactive island - includes JavaScript */}
22      <Counter />
23 
24      {/* More static content */}
25      <footer>Copyright 2024</footer>
26    </div>
27  );
28}
âœ“

Performance Benefits

Islands reduce JavaScript bundle size by 80-90% compared to full hydration!

Meta Tags & SEO

1import { Meta, Title, Link } from 'philjs-core/web';
2 
3function BlogPost(props: { post: Post }) {
4  return (
5    <>
6      <Title>{props.post.title} - My Blog</Title>
7      <Meta name="description" content={props.post.excerpt} />
8      <Meta property="og:title" content={props.post.title} />
9      <Meta property="og:description" content={props.post.excerpt} />
10      <Meta property="og:image" content={props.post.imageUrl} />
11      <Meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image" />
12      <Link rel="canonical" href={`https://myblog.com/posts/${props.post.slug}`} />
13 
14      <article>
15        <h1>{props.post.title}</h1>
16        <div innerHTML={props.post.content} />
17      </article>
18    </>
19  );
20}

SSR with Routing

1import { Router, Route } from 'philjs-router';
2 
3function App(props: { url: string }) {
4  return (
5    <Router url={props.url}>
6      <Route path="/" component={Home} />
7      <Route path="/about" component={About} />
8      <Route path="/users/:id" component={UserProfile} />
9      <Route path="*" component={NotFound} />
10    </Router>
11  );
12}
13 
14// Server
15import { renderToString } from 'philjs-core/web';
16 
17app.get('*', (req, res) => {
18  const html = renderToString(() => <App url={req.url} />);
19 
20  res.send(`
21    <!DOCTYPE html>
22    <html>
23      <head>
24        <title>My App</title>
25        <script type="module" src="/src/entry-client.tsx"></script>
26      </head>
27      <body>
28        <div id="app">${html}</div>
29      </body>
30    </html>
31  `);
32});

Hydration

PhilJS automatically matches server-rendered HTML with client-side components:

1// Client entry
2import { hydrate } from 'philjs-core/web';
3import App from './App';
4 
5// Hydrate the server-rendered content
6hydrate(
7  () => <App />,
8  document.getElementById('app')!
9);

Progressive Hydration

1import { lazy } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3// Component only hydrates when it comes into view
4const HeavyComponent = lazy(() => import('./HeavyComponent'), {
5  ssr: true,
6  hydrate: 'visible', // Options: 'visible', 'idle', 'interaction'
7});
8 
9function App() {
10  return (
11    <div>
12      <Header />
13      <Suspense>
14        <HeavyComponent />
15      </Suspense>
16    </div>
17  );
18}

Caching Strategies

Component-Level Caching

1import { createAsync, cache } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3// Cache function results
4const getUser = cache(async (id: string) => {
5  const res = await fetch(`/api/users/${id}`);
6  return res.json();
7}, 'users');
8 
9function UserProfile(props: { id: string }) {
10  const user = createAsync(() => getUser(props.id));
11 
12  return (
13    <Show when={user()}>
14      {(userData) => <div>{userData.name}</div>}
15    </Show>
16  );
17}

Page-Level Caching

1// server.ts
2import { LRUCache } from 'lru-cache';
3 
4const cache = new LRUCache({
5  max: 500,
6  ttl: 1000 * 60 * 5, // 5 minutes
7});
8 
9app.get('*', (req, res) => {
10  const cacheKey = req.url;
11  const cached = cache.get(cacheKey);
12 
13  if (cached) {
14    return res.send(cached);
15  }
16 
17  const html = renderToString(() => <App url={req.url} />);
18  cache.set(cacheKey, html);
19 
20  res.send(html);
21});

Static Site Generation

build.tstypescript
1// build.ts
2import { renderToString } from 'philjs-core/web';
3import { writeFileSync, mkdirSync } from 'fs';
4import { routes } from './routes';
5 
6for (const route of routes) {
7  const html = renderToString(() => <App url={route.path} />);
8 
9  const filePath = `dist${route.path}/index.html`;
10  mkdirSync(path.dirname(filePath), { recursive: true });
11  writeFileSync(filePath, html);
12}
13 
14console.log('Static site generated!');
Terminal
$ts-node build.ts
$npx serve dist

Deployment

Node.js Server

server.tstypescript
1import express from 'express';
2import { renderToString } from 'philjs-core/web';
3import { App } from './App';
4 
5const app = express();
6 
7app.use(express.static('dist/client'));
8 
9app.get('*', (req, res) => {
10  const html = renderToString(() => <App url={req.url} />);
11 
12  res.send(`
13    <!DOCTYPE html>
14    <html>
15      <head>
16        <link rel="stylesheet" href="/assets/style.css">
17      </head>
18      <body>
19        <div id="app">${html}</div>
20        <script type="module" src="/assets/client.js"></script>
21      </body>
22    </html>
23  `);
24});
25 
26app.listen(3000, () => {
27  console.log('Server running on http://localhost:3000');
28});

Serverless (Vercel/Netlify)

1// api/render.ts
2import { renderToString } from 'philjs-core/web';
3import { App } from '../src/App';
4 
5export default function handler(req, res) {
6  const html = renderToString(() => <App url={req.url} />);
7 
8  res.setHeader('Content-Type', 'text/html');
9  res.send(html);
10}

Best Practices

  1. Use Suspense boundaries: Prevent entire page from waiting
  2. Implement streaming: Improve perceived performance
  3. Cache aggressively: Reduce server load
  4. Use islands for interactive parts: Minimize JavaScript
  5. Optimize images and assets: Use CDN when possible
  6. Monitor performance: Track Time to First Byte, FCP, LCP
